discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment:
> ```coq
> Lemma big_rev_mkord m n P F :
>  \big[op/idx]_(m <= k < n | P k) F k = \big[op/idx]_(k < n - m | P (n - k.+1)) F (n - k.+1).
> Proof.
> rewrite big_nat_rev (big_addn 0)/= big_mkord.
> by apply: eq_bigr => i; rewrite -addSn addnC subnDr.
> Qed.
> ```
> 
> I'm not yet sure about the name though...

By the look at `big_geq_mkord`, this looks like a reasonable name to me.

discussion.author: chdoc
discussion.comment: From what I remember, I had simply missed that the order is in fact reversed, because my expectation was to find a lemma where the range has been shifted down (so that it begins with 0) without reversing the bigop. :man_shrugging:

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: `leq_fact` seems more appropriate for `{mono factorial : m n / m <= n}`. I would pick the name `fact_geq` for this one.
